His hair is cropped close and he looks to be a senior in high school.  His girl, JENNY, is nondescript, neither ugly nor beautiful. She is the kind of girl most guys would pass without a second look. Toby gets up from his booth and goes to the bathroom.  After he is gone Jenny walks to Bobby.

Reluctantly Bobby rises, facing off against Toby, each clenching their fist and waiting for the other to make the first move. The tension builds.  We see it on the faces of Jenny, Flo and the regulars.  Just then the record on the juke ends and the needle scratches off.  There is the crackle of a police radio as the door to the diner opens and SHERIFF VIRGIL POTTER walks in. The tension eases. Toby, mindful of the sheriff, steps closer to Bobby and whispers menacingly into his ear.

direction.raw_text: You're lucky, Mister.  Don't think it's over.  I called you out and I'm gonna see this through.  You hear me? (to Jenny) Come on, girl.  I got half a mind to make you walk home. Toby takes Jenny by the arm and pulls her out of the diner.

Slowly he eases his hand towards the drawer. It gets closer and closer.  As he is about to grab the money there, the cat - the same one he kicked away earlier - hisses and claws at his hand.  Bobby jumps back startled.

ARKADY, dressed in a silk suit with conspicuous jewelry, sits behind his desk eating lunch and cleaning his nails.  SERGEI, his goon in a shiny polyester shirt, hovers over his boss helping feed and manicure him.  These are the TWO MEN from Bobby's earlier FLASHBACK.  They are dangerous in an endearing way.  Sergei answers the phone. In the background is a very voluptuous female, obviously from the Middle East. SOFIA.

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Mr. Arkady.(into phone)"Hello?"

direction.raw_text: Mr. Arkady, deadbeat Cooper's calling. Mr. Arkady doesn't acknowledge him.

direction.raw_text: : EXT. PHONE BOOTH - STREET BOBBY on the phone.

direction.raw_text: I know, Mr. Arkadin. I know. I was on my way to you, it's just ... what a day I've had. I know I'm coming up with a highly improbable story, and I know you're not going to believe this, but this ...is... what happened. I had the money, I swear I had it. I was on my way to Vegas when my car breaks down in the middle of nowhere. Mr. Arkady cleans his nails completely disinterested in what Bobby is saying.

direction.raw_text: With a shotgun !  She kills both of 'em, and... and the money in my bag gets all shredded to bloody pieces. Not one bill is left alive.  I mean, what are the odds?

direction.raw_text: Mr. Arkady, honest, I ad to beat it outta there before the cops showed. So now I don't have a cent to my name. I can't even get my car out of the garage.  I tell you, Mister... (pause) if it weren't for bad luck I wouldn't have nay fuckin' luck at all, you know? (beat, waits)  So, I was wondering if you could wire me a hundred fifty-dollars so I could get my car out of this garage, see?  The bus depot here has a Western Union thing.  And of course I'll pay it back with the rest of the money.

direction.raw_text: Which you don't have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But which I can get. No problem. Look, I can sell my car in Vegas. Blue book it's worth 16 at least. I just need the 150, uh... Sergei looks like he's ready to pound heads.

direction.raw_text: Yeah, if you could send it care of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Now, let me get this straight. Two years you give me problems with your fuckin' payoffs. Now you owe me thirteen-thousand dollars, you call me - collect - then ask me to wire you one-hundred-fifty dollars just so you can get your car fixed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hundred-forty-five would probably cover it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hundred and ... Now you listen to me you deadbeat little punk:  I don't care if you got hit by a truck and run over by a steamroller.  You owe me thirteen-thousand dollars and I want it .  I don't care how you get it, or where from, but I want it on my desk tomorrow, or I'll show you what real bad luck is. Sergei snaps a pencil he's holding in his hand, which goes flying by Arkady's head, forcing him to duck.

direction.raw_text: Do you understand me you little fuck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, fuck you too!

direction.raw_text: What'd you say to me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit I'm sorry!...you can't believe the strain I'm under. I'm just under a lot of strain here. There is a sharp silence at the other end. Bobby waits.

direction.raw_text: Bobby, you owed me that 'bread' 4 weeks ago. Now you tell me you want another week. That's 5 weeks, Bobby. That's also 5 fingers, cause you and I know it's a finger a week Bobby. So you got balls. Good--now you come here tomorrow and you talk to me real nice and maybe I don't take the other 3 fingers you owe me, you see? Tomorrow -- and Bobby, don't make me come look for you, okay...have nice day. He hands the phone back to Sergei.

direction.raw_text: You got that? -- have nice day (hangs up).

direction.raw_text: The nerva that piece of shit! And look at you, you Neanderthal -- don't you fuckin' break pencils, you goombah!

direction.raw_text: Finger? What are you, a faggot? In my country a man don't pay we cut off his head. Arkady motions Sergei to come close.

direction.raw_text: Get your ass down to this Superior, Arizona. Bring me this Bobby Cooper. I don't think he got the lesson. This is your last chance, Sergei.

direction.raw_text: Da. EXT. STREET - DAY BOBBY, desperate, stares at the bandage of his wounded hand. It throbs, holding the hand to his ear. We hear an OPERATOR'S VOICE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?

direction.raw_text: Are you finished with your call?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please deposit an additional seventy-five cents. Bobby slams the phone against the hook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn rat's ass fuck! Shit! Damn! Damn! Damn! He marches from the phone booth, past an old HARDWARE STORE. The phone falls from the hook and we hear a recorded voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for using AT&T. In the store window, Bobby notices a set of garden shears for sale. EXT. EMPTY STREET - LATER DAY BOBBY walks a bit going nowhere in particular.  Looking at his watch thinking of Mr. Arkady, he shields himself with one hand from the sun.  At the side of an old building, in the bit of shade it throws, he twists at the beer cap which sticks and won't turn.  Bobby tries again twisting harder -- too hard -- as the cap jerkily twists off, cutting into his hand as it rotates. Bobby yells in pain.  At the same time the beer comes foaming from the bottle and spills onto his sleeve. The bottle slips from his wet fingers and crashes on the ground, emptying. He clutches his bleeding hand, pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck! Fuck! Fuck! I hate this fuckin' town! I hate it! Do you hear me? (no answer) Get me outta here, please.  I gotta get out of this place. As if in answer, a JEEP drives by on the main street. GRACE looks pretty hot up there in the driver's seat, her eyes, behind sunglasses, flicking over him but not acknowledging him as she keeps going. Bobby's eyes throw back his own hostility at her, but unfortunately she misses it, as he now notices -- across the street -- a well-kept building with the most modern decor and signage, reading "McKenna's Realty Co." He thinks about it, in a quandary. EXT. HIGHWAY/CAR - DAY In a rented convertible, we now see SERGEI racing across the desert. His jacket off, a man with a mission. He glances at his watch, eager to get to this "fucking hole in the wall" which is somewhere on this incomprehensible American map he holds in one hand. INT. JAKE'S REALTY OFFICE - DAY BOBBY squats, looking at a real estate model of a desert development. JAKE smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do for you, lad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was hoping we could talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk?  About what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About things.  About your wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweet Grace?  What about her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About what you said this morning. Jake shakes his head as if he doesn't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you had an insurance policy out on your wife.  Fifty-thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you'd cut that up with the man who did her in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't play simple with me, Jake. You're a betting man. You want me to spell it out for you? I'll kill Grace if you cut me in on the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy I think this heat's getting to you the way you're rambling on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not rambling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're talking like a madman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then, I guess that qualifies me for citizenship in this town. You're the one brought it up. This morning. In your car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that was just loose talk. Husband gettin' pissed off.  I don't want anybody dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit.  You wanted me to kill her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man doesn't always mean the things he says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You meant it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you say that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're a slimy bastard who would have his wife killed just to get his hands on some money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what does that make you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The slimy bastard who's going to do it for you... (pause) You're a jealous man Jake. If you can't have Grace to yourself...well, you're not the sharing kind. For a moment Jake stares quietly at Bobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I guess I have what you call a love-hate relationship with Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You love her, but you hate her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I hate loving her. I hate the kind of person she is. I hate having to tolerate the little "games" she plays. Like fucking half of the town behind my back and laughing at me. The bitch. She loved to play. She wants me to hit her and when I hit her she likes it. She tortures me. But she's family. She's my little girl. My baby. I couldn't stand to watch her eyes roll back in her head as she sucks her last breath, or to see her pretty pink brains spill from her skull. No. Not me. But you? You got the killing in you, boy...How much you want? A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it twenty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-thousand?  I don't have that kind of money.  I won't get the insurance until months after she's dead.  I don't imagine you'll want to be stickin' around after poor Grace's demise.  Twenty-thousand; that's more money than I could ever get my hands on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much could you get?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe ... ten-thousand.  And that's a maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need thirteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a bit much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not talking about buying a car Jake. We're talking about killing your wife. It's thirteen, or it's nothing. For a moment the two men stand silent.  All we hear is the ticking of a grandfather CLOCK that stands in the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You drive a hard bargain, but I had a feeling you were my boy when I met you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not your boy.  I don't like you.  I got no choice but to do business with you. Let's just call this a nasty little marriage of convenience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say that.  I had a marriage of convenience with Grace, and look where that's lead...  Well, looks like we got ourselves a contract.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we shake hands?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you can't trust the man you've hired to kill your wife ...? The thing is it's got to look like an accident; that's the thing. If it doesn't, then it's no good.  I won't get a dime, and it's my neck that'll be on the chopping block while you're living it up somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you want it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell should I know?  I've never had a wife killed before. Jesus Christ! You want this job, you don't know how to do this? I guess I should have hired a professional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to do this yourself?  I don't have to do this, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be quiet, boy.  I got to figure this thing. I'm thinking. It can't be done at the house. It should be... Jake walks the office thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come to think of it, how 'bout some money upfront?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah sure. Why don't I buy you a plane ticket right out of here while I'm at it. I know you ... (then) This is what you do:  Go to the house to see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) And tell her what? EXT. MCKENNA HOUSE - LATER DAY BOBBY stands on the porch talking to GRACE through the screen of the front door.  The look on his face is sincere.  Hers is skeptical.  We see the action take place as we hear Jake's V.O.:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I don't know.  Tell her you had to see her.  Tell her you don't care if she's married or not, you had to be with her. Sweet talk the woman.  A young buck like you must be good at that.  Then ... maybe shift the conversation.  Get her thinking about that jeep of hers.  She loves that thing.  Maybe the only thing she does love. She'll want to take you for a ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you're not surprised I'm back here, cause you can read my mind and all. She's not surprised.
direction.name: direction

Bobby's MUSTANG sits prominently in the car bay, washed and gleaming, as BOBBY walks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey there.  I was beginnin' to think you wasn't comin' back...  You don't look so good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, I've been around the bend a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of those days you feel like you been runnin' in circles and you ain't no closer to where you tryin' to get than when you started?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, I've had days I would gladly trade with a whippin' dog.  Ain't much you can do when you feel like that 'cept tough it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think bad, and bad is what you get.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a good piece of advice, Darrell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No charge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Darrell, about that hundred-fifty bucks for the car, as soon as I get where I'm going I swear I'll--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two-hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's going to cost you two-hundred dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said this morning the hose was going to run me one-fifty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep.  For the hose.  But while you was gone I replaced a gasket.  That's going to run you another fifty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't tell you to replace any gasket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but it was shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a fuck! I didn't tell you to do it!  You can't just do unauthorized work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, now, you just know all there is about bein' a mechanic, don't you?  Didn't you read the sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What sign?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The goddamn sign on the wall. I can't do unauthorized work?  What am I suppose to do? Just let you ride out of here with a bad gasket.  Then you get in an accident and get killed.  Or worse.  Who they gonna blame then?  They gonna blame me, and there goes my reputation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What reputation?  You're nothing but an ignorant, inbred, tumbleweed hick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that an insult?  Are you insulting me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen you stupid fuck, I want my car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me you sorry sonufabitch. You owe me money, and this car ain't going nowheres until I get it.  And if you take another five hours I'll find another fifty dollars worth of work to do on it. Is that clear? Now get out of here 'fore I call the Sheriff, who knows me . Bobby is in a rage.  He turns to leave and walks a few paces. He sees a WRENCH lying on a table.  For a second his mind reels, then he snatches up the wrench and turns ready to smash it down on Darrell's head.  He stops cold.  Because ol' Darrell holds a CROWBAR in a batter's stance ready to smash it onto the Mustang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to play, Mister?  I'll play with you.  You want to smash something?  So do I. Darrell pulls back the crowbar, ready to swing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Okay! Okay!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?  The fight gone out of you?  I'm just gonna smash a headlight. Maybe two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, just leave the car alone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister, you already pissed me off but good. Darrell lays the tip of the crowbar on the hood of the car, and drags the tip of the bar across the hood leaving a long scratch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn you!  You son of a bitch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you go, sweet talking me again. Darrell begins to laugh. Bobby, desperate, looks to the trunk, thinking of his gun in there. His POV -- the trunk. A FLASHBACK of the GUN goes through his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Harlin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darrell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darrell. I'll get you your money. I just have to get something out of the trunk. Using his TRUNK KEY, he tries to open it but realizes the lock has been changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck did you do to my trunk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that key's not gonna work. I had to pop the lock. You didn't leave me the trunk key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you had to go into the trunk, didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I work on a car, I work on a car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You motherfucker! (etc.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't help yourself, can you mister? You're out of control. Darrell starts to laugh. It is a repetitive, almost demonic laugh that grows louder as the camera slowly dollies in on Bobby's anguished face. EXT. STREET - DAY As BOBBY steps out into the glaring sun, he notices down at the other end of the town, GRACE'S JEEP parked right outside the SHERIFF'S OFFICE, empty. Presently, GRACE and the SHERIFF walk out TALKING, and she gets in, says a few last words and drives away. Bobby backs around a corner into a sidestreet. Is she selling him out? He's very confused, turbulent. INT. BUS DEPOT - LATER DAY BOBBY enters the BUS DEPOT.  The interior is poorly lit.  There are a few benches for people to wait on, but they sit empty. Old, faded travel posters hang on the wall.  A bored FEMALE CLERK is behind the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a ticket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, in particular?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Mexico.  You got a bus that goes to Mexico?  That's where I have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mexico is a large country. Where in Mexico would you like--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care, just get me there. The clerk is a little put off by Bobby. He seems delirious. She goes through her schedule looking for a bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about Ciudad Juarez? You could take a local, arrives in two hours, and transfer in Albuquerque. It'll get you across the border.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One way, or round trip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .55. Twenty more will get you back. Bobby counts his money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-seven, fifty.  That's all I got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ticket is 30.55.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bought a beer.  That was a dollar something. Then I gave that girl 25 cents for the juke box. And the blind man...the soda...I..I'd have 30 if...if...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir.  It's $30.55 for the ticket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Just a little short.  Figures.  I just wanted to get out, that's all. Bobby starts to walk away. Suddenly he turns, runs back at the clerk, proffers his money, half-crazed, near tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, ma'am, you don't understand! I have to get out of here.  They're going to come looking for me. They're going to kill me . If I can't get this ticket then I'm going to have to do things to get out of here. You know what I mean ! I don't want to hurt anybody, I just want to leave. Please . I can't...I can't. He's so desperate and in her frightened but neutral expression, Bobby experiences the only compassion he ever finds in this whole town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I'll give you the ticket, sir, but...just...just, please calm down, please! her sane tone reminds Bobby of how far down he's come. He shrinks, suddenly ashamed of himself. She takes the cash on the counter, hands him a ticket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep your change.  Bus three-twenty-three. Leaves at seven fifty two, tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.  It's just ... you know ... She nods, puts a "closed" sign in the ticket window, disappears. EXT. BUS DEPOT - LATE DAY We hear the crackle of the same POLICE RADIO again, OFF CAMERA, as BOBBY walks out of the depot. ticket preciously held in his hand, and suddenly reels as he sees SERGEI, about a 100 yards down the main stretch, slowly rolling into town in his convertible, looking for guess who.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit! INT. SERGEI'S CAR - SIMULTANEOUS BOBBY turns away, but not fast enough. SERGEI spots him, hits the pedal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got you, shitface! Bobby Cooper. Bobby Cooper... EXT. MAIN STREET - SIMULTANEOUS BOBBY, ducking around a corner, hears the brief "Whoop" of the sheriff's POLICE SIREN. He glances back. His POV - sure enough, the SHERIFF'S having a field day. He's just pulled SERGEI over. At this distance, we catch snippets of conversation as the Sheriff ambles from his car, checking Sergei's out-of-state plates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the fire sweetheart? Don't know how they work things in Nevada, but we got speed limits in this state.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vat? I am going 5 miles an hour! I am looking town. I not even moving. We pop in closer to their conversation -- Bobby relishing this in his mind's eye. Sergei is constantly looking off to where he last saw Bobby. But the Sheriff, strangely, pays no attention to these looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, what kind of accent you got there? You one of them Russians?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Russian, da! I am also rich Russian, da? Maybe we work something out, my friend Sheriff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You trying to bribe me, mister? Just cause you Russians ain't commies anymore, don't think money can buy everything... Down the street, Sheriff Potter is holding up a concealed GUN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? (He grabs the gun) ..."concealed" is a definite no no in this town, Ivan. You know anything about Jamilla's grocery store?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What fuckin grocery store, you fucking shithead idiot! You call yourself a police... Sergei looking Bobby's direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of the car, spread them. You can jawbone all you want or you have the right to shut the fuck up ! You commie motherfucker. Either way you're goin' to the can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want my lawyer! Sheriff cuffs Sergei and sticks him in the police car. Bobby can't help smiling as he turns away to the SODA MACHINE seen in an earlier scene. He comes up with the change the bus clerk left him and, dying for a drink in this heat, inserts the coin. Though still under considerable pressure from all sides, this lucky break with Sergei seems like it might be the beginning of something new today -- some luck. The icy cold soda bottle shoots out. Bobby raises it to his lips, about to taste it, about to relax for once. Violently it explodes out of his hands as he doubles over in blinding pain from a KIDNEY PUNCH. He stumbles forward into the soda machine, gasping. The legs of his assailant are close to him, but the face is unseen. Bobby doubles his agony as his bandaged left stump takes the brunt of the blow into the machine, re-opening the wound. Blood starts to seep through the bandage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow! Bobby crumples to the ground as TOBY now towers over him with his fists curled and a snarl on his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get up, Mister!  Don't ever let it be said Toby Tucker beat the living shit out of someone without giving them a fair chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doing?  You fucking psycho!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm doing what any man would do if he'd been offended.  I'm stompin' your ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You idiot!  You don't even know what you're fighting over!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My honor, that's what I'm fighting over. Now get up off the ground, or do I have to whoop you where you lie? JENNY comes running up the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby!  Toby Tucker, leave him alone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stay away, Jenny.  I aim to mess him up, and that ain't a thing for a woman to see. Jenny runs to Bobby and cuddles him where he lays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be afraid of him none.  I don't care what he does to you, we can still be together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from me! Bobby sees his bus ticket on the ground.  He grabs for it, but Toby beats him to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, what's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it to me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mexico?  You going to Mexico?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving.  You never have to see me again.  Just please, give me the ticket!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This means something to you?  Jenny means something to me. Toby sticks the ticket in his mouth and chews it up whole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nooo!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna beat you so bad you gonna be eatin' nothing but soup the erst of your days.  Rain dogs is gonna be prettier than you when I'm done.  I'm gonna mess you up so bad you gonna make your own momma sick. I'm gonna ... Toby's words drift to Bobby from a million miles away.  The world around him is like a dream, or a nightmare.  A primal rage wells inside of Bobby that rises up in a howl as he swings the soda bottle up out of nowhere across Toby's head, smashing him backwards. Then he lands blow after blow with his right hand on the boy's face and head. Jenny screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it!  You're killing him! Jenny grabs Bobby's arm, literally hanging all her weight on it, stopping him from striking Toby again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're killing him!  Toby!?  Toby!? Jenny sinks to the ground and cuddles Toby.  Bobby stands.  He looks at Toby, then at his bloodied knuckles in disbelief. His bandage is soaked with his own blood, but his adrenaline numbs the pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed him! You killed him! She wails in the background as he backs away, around the corner, into Main Street, crossing to where the PHONE BOOTH is. EXT. PHONE BOOTH - LATE DAY BOBBY is on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Grace?  It's Bobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MCKENNA HOUSE - SIMULTANEOUS GRACE, in the kitchen, is also on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you'd be on your way to Vegas by now.  Is there something you wanted?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think we have anything to talk about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no us, remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except I can't get you out of my head, Grace. (beat)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?  Am I making you hot, or does the truth scare you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I know you're full of shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean it, Grace.  I'm getting out of here, and I want to take you with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you couldn't get your car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could if I had Jake's money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what changed your mind?  The money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a damn about the money.  I want you, and I want to get us out of this shithole.  There's only one way to do that. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?...  About me, I mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came back for you; this morning I came back.  Before I even knew about the money. You're what I want. (then) The only reason I stormed off is because you spooked me talking about Jake.  But I've had nothing but time to think about it.  It keeps coming back to you and me and us getting the hell out of here.  But we've got to get the money, baby.  We get the money, I get the car, then we get the hell out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you couldn't kill anybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have to kill him.  Just knock him out and tie him up 'till we get away. (beat) It was your idea, remember?  I'm doing this for you.  I'm doing this so you can fly...fly like a bird. Grace bites at a nail and fidgets, but says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace ... Grace?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After dark.  I'll leave the back door unlocked. She quickly hangs up the phone. Bobby also hangs up the phone, an unreadable expression on his face. INT. MCKENNA LIVING ROOM - LATE DAY JAKE sits in an easy chair reading a paper.  Puffs of smoke from his pipe rise from behind the paper and hang like a cloud over his head.  GRACE stands in the doorway, body stiff and arms crossed, staring at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was that on the phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrong number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spent a long time talking for a wrong number.  But then you make friends so easily.  Don't you, Grace? Grace has no answer for that, so she says nothing.  A long moment passes, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I put up new drapes, Jake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.  I was here when your apprentice was helping you.  Remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never said anything.  About the drapes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't even looked at them once. Jake lowers the paper, looks at the drapes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I picked them out for you, Jake.  I thought you would like the colors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look just like your mama when you move like that against the light. Grace stares at the CHAIN now visible around Jake's neck that disappears under his shirt.  She knows that hidden there is a key, and she fixes on it intently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell you looking at, girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing, Jake.  Absolutely nothing. EXT. DESERT - EVENING The SUN is setting. It strikes the horizon sending a ripple of golden light through the sky. EXT. PORCH OF HOUSE - EVENING A MAN dances in the evening light with a small child in his arms. EXT. CORNER OF HOUSE - EVENING A DOG and CAT huddle together in sleep. EXT. POLICE STATION - EVENING SHERIFF VIRGIL POTTER is tossing horseshoes with his DEPUTIES. EXT. MCKENNA HOUSE - EVENING GRACE watches the sun going down outside her house, cradling herself in her arms. A desert wind gently caresses her. EXT. STREET CORNER - NIGHT The BLIND MAN, along with his dead DOG, sits on the side of the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's it.  Sun's going down.  People go home, trade stories over dinner. They'll talk about the day, about the heat, laugh about something crazy it made them do.  They'll kiss, sleep a few hours, then do it all over again. BOBBY now appears next to the blind man holding two Dr. Peppers. He hands one to the blind man, takes a sip of the other one, and offers him his own change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The day wasn't so bad.  We all got through it all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep it. There's a suggestion of cockiness in Bobby, feeling his luck coming back with the night. His humour is enhanced by his POV down the street: As DARRELL, with his dilapidated truck, readies SERGEI'S convertible for towing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't over yet.  Night is part of day; separate, but equal.  Night is when you let your guard down; when you see things in the shadows and hear things in the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Difference between you and me, old man, is I see the glass half full, you see it half empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Night is when you want to sleep, but the dry heat keeps you tossin' and turnin'. It's when you wish the sun was bakin' high in the sky so you could see what it is you're afraid of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You afraid of the dark?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Afraid of it?  Boy, I live in the dark. All cause of a woman who made me this way. People are afraid of what they can't see. I can't see nuthin', so it's all the same to me.  Kiss from a beautiful woman, kissy kissy kiss, a lick from a dog, slurp, slurp, the kiss of death (he makes a strange sound). It's all the same to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, we're all just floating along like twigs in a stream, so enjoy the ride.  Is that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More or less.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not this twig, friend.  I got plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing makes the Great Spirit laugh harder than a man's plans. We all got plans. I planned on seeing all my life. I know you didn't plan on straying into town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No and I don't plan on sticking around either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, don't say I didn't warn you when things go your way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a lotta philosophy in you, old timer but you don't fool me for one second with all this blind man crap. One minute you lost your eyes in Vietnam, next it's the joint. Now it's a woman? I'm hep to you. The Blind Man slowly lifts his glasses, showing his EYES at last. Where his eyes should be are scars and dead flesh. An ugly sight that even takes Bobby back a step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used to be a young smartass like you. Then I got smart with the wrong man's daughter. Got some acid poured on my peepers for my trouble. You know human beings ain't always just human -- they got animals living inside 'em too...People give spare change to war heroes not fools. All fools get is pity. May not have eyes, but I see. And you, boy? The Blind Man puts his glasses back on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got my pity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hope she was worth it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, she was worth it.  She was worth every black minute since. Bobby looks at his watch, gets ready to go, drops a coin into the Blind Man's cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time's up. Any last words of wisdom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things ain't always the way they seem. You got to ask yourself: is it worth it? Day comes Earthmaker is going to look in your fucking heart! Then you better know what it is you're doing. Are you a human being -- or just one of them hungry ghosts out there floatin' around? Bobby walks away, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are crazy, you know. Be seeing you, old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I won't be seeing you. The Blind Man lifts his sunglasses and peers into the cup as if he sees . We don't really know. He reaches into the cup and pulls out the coin Bobby tossed in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheap bastard. Gives me back my own money... Well, Jesse, time's up, let's go for a walk. The Blind Man now stands up and pulls the seeing-eye dog's harness. The DOG struggles to its feet and they walk off down the street together. INT. MCKENNA HOUSE - NIGHT GRACE stands by the back door staring at the bolt lock. JAKE yells to her from another room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell you doin', Grace?  Are you coming to bed, or aren't you? For a moment Grace's hand wavers above the lock.  Suddenly, like a snake striking, her hand shoots out and unlocks the bolt. Just as quickly she turns from the door and heads to the bedroom. EXT. YARD - MCKENNA HOUSE - NIGHT A LIGHT is on in the bedroom window.  After a moment it dims and the house is dark, silhouetted against the horizon by moonlight. BOBBY steps into frame, carrying an iron pipe. INT. MCKENNA HOUSE/BEDROOM - SIMULTANEOUS We start close on GRACE -- a KEY slapping against her buttocks as bedsprings groan.  We reveal Grace copulating on all fours with JAKE from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya little bitch, you like it don't you! You like it this way -- rough and hard. Gotta go fuck around on me, like your Mama, but you always gotta come home to Daddy, don't you, cause you know Daddy's the best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes, hit me...beat me, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been a bad girl, Grace. You took my heart from your Mama, didn't ya? You betrayed her! Like you did me. There ain't no forgivin' ya, girl!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no! Oh please forgive me, Papa!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You broke her heart! You broke your Mama's heart. You stole me! That's right. Fuck it away. But it ain't ever goin' away, cause your Mama -- she's like a hungry ghost baby, she won't go away, she won't leave ya alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! No! Please! He hits her. Harder. In a strange flashback of his mind, he now sees Grace's MAMA beneath him, receiving his punishment. He stops, abruptly. He can't go on. Fear coming into his eyes. He starts to whimper, begging for his punishment and/or forgiveness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh baby, I'm so sorry... I'm so sorry... (he starts to cry) I didn't mean to hurt you so bad. It just...got away... He drops down, burying his face between Grace's legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, baby, forgive me! He hides there from the world that he has created, crying to himself. Grace has an unreadable expression, but that's certainly not a new occurrence in their strange relationship. INT. MCKENNA HOUSE/BACKDOOR - NIGHT The knob of the backdoor twists and the door opens.  BOBBY slips quickly through the space and into the house quietly closing the door behind him.  It is nearly pitch dark, and he has no bearings.  He steps gingerly through the hall, but in the darkness he bumps into a table nearly knocking over a lamp only to catch it just before it crashes into the floor. INT. MCKENNA HOUSE/BEDROOM - SIMULTANEOUS JAKE hears the noise.  He raises his head and cocks an ear to the air. She knows who it is, and is concerned; he's too early.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't hear something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I heard a key slapping against my ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's someone in the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe...maybe the wind blew something over (encouraging him to continue). Come on baby, keep going. Jake climbs out of bed, throwing on some pants, reaching into a drawer in the chest of clothes, pulling out a small dark metallic OBJECT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? Jake -- where's you get that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax baby. Stay here. He goes to the door. She follows, tries to block the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jake, don't go out there. Call the sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhhh! Just like your Mama, always scared of things... He maneuvers her aside and slips out the door into the corridor. INT. LIVING ROOM/MCKENNA HOUSE - SIMULTANEOUS Crowbar in one hand, BOBBY makes his way slowly through the living room, banging against the edge of a table. He hops silently in pain, then waits at the door to the next room and listens.  Hearing nothing he slowly pokes his head into the darkness.  A moment later Bobby backs from the door and we see the barrel of his own black .9mm BARETTA pressed against his forehead.  JAKE appears now, backing him into the living room. He switches on a LAMP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well.  As I live and breathe.  I didn't expect to be seeing the like of you again.  Thought you'd be long on your way by now. Jake continues to press the gun to Bobby's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my gun...(then) That fucking Darrell!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like Darrell.  He may be an idiot, but he's my half brother. We own Harlin's together, yeah, that little redneck manages to get paid no matter how things work out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been workin' me the whole time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess this is what they call "ironee"? Hunh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not what you think, Jake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but it don't matter anyway when you're lying there with your brains all over my carpet and I'm telling Sheriff Potter about this drifter, didn't have enough money to fix his car. And Darrell happened to find his gun, and through maybe this drifter heard old Jake got some money stashed away, and figgered he might try to break in and steal it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute.  Just listen to me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...And he thought he'd clock old Jake McKenna and turn his brains into wall paper...and then maybe borrow $200 or $20,000, or $200,000...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not the reason I'm here, Jake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's another reason? It better be good. INT. HALLWAY - SIMULTANEOUS GRACE makes her way down the hall in a nightgown, and now hides in shadow, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came for Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You came to take my wife from me? INT. LIVING ROOM - SIMULTANEOUS BOBBY (sincere) No. I came to kill her. INT. HALLWAY GRACE'S eyes get real narrow and angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh! Liar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the truth, Jake. INT. LIVING ROOM JAKE That's a thick change of heart from this afternoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I don't like being played, like she played us today.  Maybe I don't like that at all, Jake. I'm just pissed enough, maybe I'll rip the neck off my own grandmother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a lot of talk in you, whole lot of talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn it, Jake. There is a guy coming to kill me, and if it comes down to me or Grace, then I pick Grace.  You were going to give me thirteen-thousand.  Give me two-hundred.  I'll kill her and dump the body where no one will ever find it. She showed me the perfect place. There won't be enough left for an autopsy.  But I need the the money.  I've got to have the money. Jake is silent.  He takes his time thinking.  Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's in the bedroom. INT. HALLWAY GRACE, distressed, starts backing off towards the bedroom. INT. LIVING ROOM BOBBY stares at the automatic in JAKE's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna give me my gun? Jake laughs, a "don't even think about it" look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A strangling'll do just fine. Go to work. Bobby holds up his eight fingers with a "you try" look. Jake shrugs. Bobby points to the crowbar on the carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout the pipe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's got a slender neck. Bobby turns and walks towards the bedroom. Jake follows into an adjoining room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on a second! Come here! Bobby turns to Jake, who is suddenly extremely upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell did you know where the bedroom's at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This morning when I came in on you and Grace, you swore you hadn't been near the bedroom. Now you make straight for it. INT. HALLWAY GRACE returns to listen. This thing is like a seesaw battle of wills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Jake -- JAKE (V.O.) Don't Jake me boy! It's a big house. You probably didn't even make it out to the desert this afternoon... INT. LIVING ROOM JAKE has come right up on BOBBY in a rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Or did you just ply the afternoon away between my sheets putting your lips all over her, you little horndog...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What difference does it make if I slept with her? We're gonna kill her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right! I don't give a damn about her. But killing her's one thing. Fucking her behind my back, that's another! Suddenly Jake swings his arm, clipping Bobby across the side of the head with the pistol and opening another bloody gash. Bobby crumbles to his knees, crying out. Jake suddenly grabs Bobby by the hair, forcing his face back and smearing his lips with his own in a vengeful kiss. The blood from Bobby's wound runs down to his lips and mixes with Jake's lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .K.! I admit it! I fucked her! But it's her you have to worry about, not me ! She wants you dead , Jake. She wants you dead and she wants your money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you babbling about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think about it! How do you think I got in here? Did you hear any glass break? Did you hear a door splinter? INT. HALLWAY - SIMULTANEOUS GRACE listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did the evening end?  After you went to bed did she linger a bit?  Maybe just long enough to leave the door unlocked?  Is that what happened? INT. LIVING ROOM - SIMULTANEOUS Like an old rag, JAKE gradually soaks all this up becoming heavier with the weight of the knowledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd tell me anything to save your pathetic life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what kind of woman Grace is, Jake. You know how badly she wants to get the fuck out of Superior.  What's she to you, Jake; a woman who wants you dead?  Let me kill her.  All I want is two-hundred dollars to get out of here with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two-hundred dollars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two-hundred dollars...I'll do it!  I'll kill her! A beat. Jake stares down at Bobby on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweet Christ, I'd be doing the world a favor, ridding it of the likes of you. Get your miserable ass off the floor. You're positively pathetic... Go on, go kill Grace. Bobby slowly stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not letting you walk for nothing. Two hundred dollars. Do it, boy. Kill her . Bobby goes. INT. HALLWAY - SIMULTANEOUS GRACE bolts back to the bedroom, the camera following her as she flies. INT. BEDROOM HALLWAY - NIGHT (MOMENTS LATER) BOBBY walks it. His POV -- the door. Every step seems freighted. INT. BEDROOM - SIMULTANEOUS GRACE is in a quandary. How many seconds before Bobby walks in to kill her? Or can he really kill her? She's not sure. She looks around the room frantically. Picks up a lamp, puts it down. She looks quickly through her closet, rummages below in the boxes. Suddenly she finds it. A dangerous looking Indian HATCHET with a feather hanging off its bindings. It's a formidable piece of iron, quite capable of splitting a skull or impaling flesh. Grace hears the footsteps just outside the door. She runs behind the door. A moment later, the bedroom door creaks open and BOBBY quietly enters, approaching the bed. We sense the doubt in his eyes as to whether he can kill her. In a reverse POV, Bobby sees the outline of Grace in the bed as victim...closer, closer.  He now lifts the edge of the bedcover but sees a blanket bunched up to resemble a human figure. He suddenly hears a foot fall behind him, then he feels her presence. He spins. She's directly behind him , hatchet raised. His life is in her hands. His eyes, locked in an eternal moment. Her eyes, the hatchet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HALLWAY - SIMULTANEOUS As JAKE, anxiously torn, waits, there is a LOUD CRASH, followed by SOUNDS of struggle, of murder, of death. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jake! It is a desperate cry for help. Jake can't help himself. He breaks into a roaring run down the hall to save his beloved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace!! INT. BEDROOM - SIMULTANEOUS JAKE bulls into the bedroom. It's a mess, furniture overturned, sheets and blankets all over the floor. The lights broken. Waiting for him, face down on the floor, is BOBBY'S BODY in a pool of liquid. A broken bottle lies nearby. Bobby's body heaves in its final death throes, and then shudders quiet...  Over there, by the bed, is GRACE, who still clutches the HATCHET. The look on her face is pure shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...looks like you got him, Grace. That's good...that's real good.  He must of slipped past me, but you got him.  Looks like that drifter from this morning.  Got to be careful who you make friends with, sweetheart. Jake eyes the weapon in Grace's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you put that down? It's all over now.  Put it down. Grace eyes the gun in Jake's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on, girl.  Put it down. What choice does Grace have?  She lets the hatchet clank to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aww, that's my Grace:  Not about to let someone get the best of her.  That's what I love about you.  As dangerous as you are unpredictable. behind Jake, the lifeless BOBBY rises up from the floor, very much alive, and clobbers Jake with a golf club. Jake is staggered, but he's one tough old customer as he manages to spin slowly, gun still in one hand, as if to fire. Before he can, Grace grabs up the hatchet from the floor and drives it straight into his back. He gurgles, stunned from both sides, but it's like trying to kill Rasputin. He still has the gun as Bobby jumps him from the rear, trying to get his neck in a chokehold. The gun FIRES once, discharging into the wall. The hatchet is ripped from his back. Grace watches as the two men bang into the walls in a rugged rodeo-type fight, Jake seeking to dislodge Bobby off his back. An expression of fear and excitement in her eyes. Finally the two men go crashing to the ground, rolling around, Bobby maintaining his stranglehold, but calling to her, his hands full.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace, goddamit, do something! Jake's eyes rolls up at her like a beaching whale, pleading for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace...? She commits. Jumping into the fray, it's not clear whose side she's really on as the three of them roll across the floor, strangling, biting, hitting, spitting, scratching, gasping. It's a Guignol, but the pressure from Bobby's forearm is taking its toll on Jake. Trying to bite Jake, Grace bites Bobby instead, but then she scratches Jake's face. Jake is grabbing her hard as Bobby chokes him, trying to use her to leverage himself away. But she manages to rip herself from his grip and scrambles on her knees across the floor. She grabs the hatchet. And stands, moving back towards the two men locked on the floor. Bobby looks up at her, hatchet in hand, no longer sure which way she'll go. Jake, however, gasping for air, eyes bulging, spittle dripping from his mouth, looks at Grace with some inner certainty that she will help him. He gasps the words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me, Grace, help...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like you helped her, Jake? Grace stands there, deciding, the power of the hatchet in her hands. She raises it suddenly over the two men. It flashes downwards. Deep into the gut of her husband Jake, almost transfixing him to the floor. In the silence that follows, Jake's eyes roll up to meet hers. But all she has for him is a cold, distant stare. Jake's head drops as the life rushes out of him. Bobby falls back from the body puffing and dripping with sweat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell'd you wait for? She doesn't answer, turbulence in her face. He rolls Jake's body off, upset. She may have made it a murder, but he was part of it, and he feels the shift in himself. They're both in new territory, feeling an apartness between them. Suddenly JAKE gasps , still alive! It is too much for Bobby. He grabs the hatchet and plunges it down on Jake, silencing him one last time. Grace is pushing the bed away from the wall, slipping down on her knees and prying open several floorboards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The money's right here! Get the key!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! You get it! He doesn't want to get close to Jake. Grace coldly runs over to his corpse, ripping the chain, key and all, from the neck. The action pulls Jake's head up, then she lets it thump back on the floor. She runs back to the floorboards. The top of a thick steel floor safe is revealed. Bobby watches -- his whole life, it seems, hanging on the outcome. With the key, she opens the safe. Inside are rolled-up bundles of cash -- in hundred dollar denominations. She looks up at him, offering it as she reaches in for more. Bobby also gets down on his hands and knees and grabs more and more, sucked into the fever of freedom, far more money than he lost at the grocery store, overcome now with emotions of fear and freedom. They see each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't I tell you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There must be 150, 200 thousand here! Goddamnit Grace, you were right!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We done it, Bobby. Oh my God! They laugh excitedly and start kissing, rolling in the stacks of cash, some of which sticks to Bobby's sweating back. The day didn't turn out so bad after all for Bobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck me baby!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him watch. I want him to know what he's missing. As they consummate their violent relationship for the first time, Jake's lifeless eyes watch them. EXT. MCKENNA HOUSE - LATER NIGHT The LIGHT in the bedroom window is low candlelight, but we sense something watching them. GRACE's silhouette moves across a window. BOBBY now comes out of the house, cautious, walking down the driveway. He stops, thinks, and walks back to open the hood of GRACE'S JEEP. He reaches into the ENGINE and disconnects something, then closes the hood and walks on. EXT. HARLIN'S GARAGE - NIGHT BOBBY walks up to the SHACK near the garage and bangs on the door. A light goes on in the window.  DARRELL shouts out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're closed.  Come back when the sun comes up. Bobby, in a hurry to get back should Grace pull any tricks, bangs and kicks against the door. Darrell yanks the door wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell ... oh, it's you.  Might've figgered. Listen I got a waitress coming over.  What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want my car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got the money? Bobby pulls the money from his hip pocket and hands it to Darrell.  The mechanic fingers it suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two-hundred dollars in hundred-dollar bills.  And this morning you was broke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's none of your business.  Get the keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want no dirty money.  I run an honest business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, like Al Capone on tax day. Get the keys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, there's a $50 overnight storage charge we got to talk about. Bobby is ready at first to explode, but then just laughs out loud. You got to give it to a guy like Darrell. He holds up a $100 bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I got's a hundred, Darrell. You got change?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Figgers. There's a scratch on the hood and how much you make selling my gun? Deduct it. Bobby pulls the hundred back from Darrell's grasp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know nothing about no gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Course you don't. Tell me something Darrell. Forty thousand people die every day! How come none of them are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you know where to find her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the trunk key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Topped off the tank for you. No charge. Just my way of doing business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen up good, Darrell. I'm getting outta this shithole. You're staying! And one little peep outta you -- remember that gun makes you part of the food chain. Your prints are all over it. I'd be awful careful whose rectum I was pointing my finger in, Darrell. Bobby hops in the car, a free man. As Darrell glares at him, bewildered and frightened at the same time. EXT. MCKENNA HOUSE - NIGHT BOBBY turns the MUSTANG up the drive. THE HEADLIGHTS cut the darkness and land on an empty patch where Grace's jeep had been parked.  Bobby jumps from the Mustang and runs around frantically. His look is devastated. He falls to his knees, about to sob when: GRACE opens the front door and pokes her head out, putting out several suitcases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby?  What the hell's the matter with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... nothing.  I just stubbed my toe on a rock.  Hurt like hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got the money all packed.  I put the jeep and his caddy in the garage. People'll think maybe me and Jake went away.  Buy us some time...I know a back road we can take.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good thinking. (looking at her four bags) What's all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not coming back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awright, let's go. I want to be fifty miles from here before the sun comes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny thing; the jeep wouldn't start. I had to push it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny thing... I'll get the bags. EXT. MCKENNA HOUSE - LATER NIGHT Bobby's MUSTANG is backed towards the front of the house.  We see a silhouette of BOBBY and GRACE carrying something wrapped in a BLANKET and dumping it in the trunk. EXT. DESERT HIGHWAY - NIGHT A lone pair of HEADLIGHTS illuminate the night as the Mustang cruises through the dark.  As the lights brighten the screen we:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT./EXT. MUSTANG - NIGHT GRACE sits next to BOBBY peering out the windshield, clutching the money in a backpack. She's humming an Indian song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It should be just up ahead.  Hold on ... there!  There it is! A SIGN illuminated by the HEADLIGHTS.  It reads:  YOU ARE LEAVING SUPERIOR.  THANKS FOR VISITING. Grace lets out a scream of joy, leans over and hugs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God!  I can't believe it.  I'm out. I'm finally out! The MUSTANG begins to swerve along the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Take it easy.  Want to get us killed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know what it feels like to be free of that place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know about that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spent a day in Superior. I wasted my entire life there. I feel like someone just took a million pounds off my shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've still got some dead weight to get rid of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't we just dump him fast someplace?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want a place where only the vultures will find him...(then) It'll be over soon, Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then will you take me on your friends' boat with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sailing his boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I thought -- BOBBY We're going to buy a boat of our own baby, and sail it wherever we want to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anywhere?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell? Why not? Where should we go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawaii. I've read all about it. I've dreamed of going there and just lying on the beach while the water licked up against my feet. Oh, God. I'd kill to go there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You already have. She gives him a funny look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I thought you'd left me back there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I got back from the garage, and your jeep wasn't there, I thought you'd gone and left me and taken the money. (off her look) ...Cause I never had any luck with women, Grace. You don't know what I been through. The shit I've taken. I thought you were like the rest of 'em... but when you came out of the house... well you're here Grace and we might be starting in the shit but we're starting where I never been -- together with someone -- together with you Grace. She responds with a luminous smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you Bobby. He looks back at her with trust and love in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna pull this off, Grace. Just then a HEADLIGHT rakes them from the rear as we hear, again, the ominous crackle of a POLICE RADIO and the short brutal "Whoop" of the siren, as Sheriff Potter's VEHICLE rolls up quickly behind them. Grace's face is caught like a surprised deer in the headlamps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God! (then) Don't stop! Bobby is in a bind. The siren whoops again. The lights flash to highbeam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He must've seen us swerving on the road, that's all, just gonna give us a ticket for swerving... But even Bobby has trouble believing that as the POLICE VEHICLE pulls out sharply alongside his and SHERIFF POTTER motions to him aggressively to pull over on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull over, goddamnit, pull over!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep going! She seems to be panicking. Bobby pulls over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck this!...Just shut up, Grace. We done nothing! Be cool. Let me do the talking. He doesn't know anything. His vehicle pulled up on the shoulder in front of them, the Sheriff gets out, shining his power flashlight into their faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Evening Sheriff, sorry bout that but this jackrabbit... Bobby has no time to react as the Sheriff is suddenly there at his window, jerking his door open, angry. A GUN in his hand, pointed at them, his eyes on Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had to fuck him , didn't you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would never do that to you, baby... He killed Jake -- said he'd kill me if I didn't come with him. All he wants is the money. Bobby looks at her. He cannot believe what he just heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...but he never made me cum! Really Virgil, I was only doing what I had to do so we could be free. Just like we talked about. It meant nothing . A pause. Virgil wants to kill her, but he also wants her back badly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fucking him too Grace? Is everybody fucking everybody in this town? She ignores him. Her attention on the backpack with the money between her legs -- the gun is there, inside an outer flap of the bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fuck this guy -- get him to do your dirty work and you think you can take the money and dump me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No baby, you got it wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This road don't go to Globe, Grace -- where were you going to meet me? His flashlight on the four suitcases in the backseat. She doesn't have an answer to that one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not like that it... Look, Virgil, I got the money here. She gets out of the car on her side, comes around to him, the pack of money slung on her shoulder, hard to see in the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Grace, you can say what you want...but, I watched you fuck that pervert for years while you're telling me you loved me? What happened to going to Milwaukee together? You and me -- gonna open up the finest sporting goods store that city ever did see? Get us a place on the north shore, by the lake? Season Brewer tickets! Just you and me, Grace. What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All talk, that's all you did was talk, and all I did was sit around getting older waiting for you to free me! You never did nothin' Virgil, you're weak! (pointing to Bobby) He did ! The Sheriff, deeply wounded, casts a hot vicious gaze on Bobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is some girl you and me got here Bobby, yessir, an excellent cocksuck too, wouldn't you say? (back at Grace)... Course you had a lotta practice haven't you darling, going way back to your crazy mama!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Virgil! Take your share of the money. It's not so bad.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now you've tasted both of us! He pulls back the hammer on the gun and levels it at Bobby's head. Bobby sees it coming, plays his last card on his knees.
dialogue.name: dialogue
